Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: July 23, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: Kaman Precision Products Inc., an Orlando, Fla., defense contractor, agreed to pay the United States $4.75 million to resolve allegations that the company submitted false claims for non-conforming fuzes sold to the U.S. Army for use in "bunkerbuster" bombs.

Info Source: Contained in data obtained on May 23, 2018 in response to a Freedom of Information Act request.

Description: Kaman Aerospace agreed to pay a $100,000 civil penalty and $320,000 towards supplemental environmental projects in settlement of allegations its facilities in the state violated environmental regulations by excessive emissions of trichloroethylene and nitrogen oxides to the air, failure to obtain a permit for a fuel-burning source, failure to keep records of hazardous solvent usage, releases of heavy metals into state waters, spills of chromic acid wastewater and fuel oil and inadequate hazardous waste management at all five facilities.
Agency: Connecticut Department of Energy & Environmental Protection
Notes: Captured from summaries produced by DEP; may not include full details of penalties.

Info Source: Contained in a spreadsheet received from the agency on October 2, 2020 in response to an open records request. The spreadsheet included data from  the agency's Oculus database, which can be searched at https://prodenv.dep.state.fl.us/DepNexus/public/searchPortal
Notes: Case number is the designation given by the DEP's Office of General Counsel.
